item.title: Self-Signed TLS certificate (1)
item.description: I researched on creating self-signed certificates in Privacy-Enhanced Mail (PEM) format for TLS with OpenSSL. Here, I do things in 3 steps: Step1: create the private key Step2: create the self-signed public certificate Step3: print out the content of the self-signed public certificate RSA (2048bit) algorhism Step1 $ openssl genpkey -algorithm rsa -out rsa_private_key.pem ... Step2 $ openssl req -new -key rsa_private_key.pem -x509 -days 3000 -out rsa_public_certificate.pem You are about to be asked to enter information that will be incorporated into your certificate request.
